caption.p: Definitions of CBAs, adapted from ( Lipp and Anklam, 1998).

tr.td: Generic term for any fat used fully or partially instead of CB in chocolate to provide similar functions.

A plant-based fat, which does not contain lauric acid, used in part or wholly instead of CB and displaying similar characteristics. When mixed with CB, it does not affect the functionality of CB in chocolate.
Plant fats that contain lauric acid and other fatty acids compositions not found in CB. This makes them unable to mix with CB so can only display acceptable properties with full CB substitution.
